case_title: MUHAMMAD SIDDIQUE QURESHI AND 3 OTHERS vs S. NASIR AHMAD SHAH (REPRESENTED BY 5 LEGAL HEIRS) AND 7 OTHERS

parties.respondent: S. Nasir Ahmad Shah (represented by 5 legal heirs) and 7 others

facts.surrendered_area_option: Allowed to purchase at Rs. 10 per P.I. Unit

parties: S. Nasir Ahmad Shah and others

civil_court_decree.result: Restrained Nawabzada Asghar Ali Khan from encumbering or interfering with possession of land

payment_history.policy_relaxation: Allowed payment of defaulted installments by 1972-06-30

legal_issues: Fraud and misrepresentation in obtaining proprietary rights
Validity of agreements without Collector's permission
Effect of ex parte civil court decree
Compliance with Colonization of Government (Lands) Punjab Act, 1912

key_orders.content: Permission granted to S. Nasir Ahmad Shah to deposit unpaid installments
Permission granted to Nawabzada Asghar Ali Khan to deposit balance price
Proprietary rights granted to Muhammad Siddique
Permission extended to S. Nasir Ahmad Shah to clear dues

findings: Transfers made without Collector's permission are void.
Ex parte civil court decree does not bind the government.
Fraud and misrepresentation invalidated proprietary rights granted to Muhammad Siddique.
directions: Nawabzada Asghar Ali Khan allowed to deposit unpaid installments within two months.
Failure to deposit will result in land resumption.
